title: Hemisphere Learning App - Master Epic
description: A learning application grounded in Iain McGilchrist's 'The Master and His Emissary'. Core thesis: the right hemisphere (The Master) provides broad, contextual, relational attention while the left hemisphere (The Emissary) provides narrow, focused, analytical attention. Modern education is heavily left-hemisphere biased. This app rebalances learning by: (1) RIGHT first - present the whole, use metaphor, narrative, embodied context, emotional engagement; (2) LEFT - analyze, categorize, abstract, practice, drill; (3) RIGHT again - return to the whole, integrate, see connections, apply in new contexts. The app uses neuroscience-informed pedagogy to improve learning outcomes through hemisphere-aware instructional design.

title: Agent 5: Learning Content Creation Agent
description:
ROLE: Creates actual learning content that follows the hemisphere-informed instructional design.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Develop sample content modules demonstrating the Right→Left→Right learning loop
- Create narrative/metaphorical introductions (RH stage)
- Develop analytical exercises and focused practice (LH stage)
- Design integration and transfer activities (RH return stage)
- Write content in multiple domains to prove the model works across subjects
- Create multimedia content specifications (what needs illustration, animation, audio)
- Develop the tone of voice and writing style guide
- Create content templates other authors can use

OUTPUTS:
- 3 complete sample learning modules (different subjects)
- Content creation style guide
- Multimedia specification documents
- Content templates with examples
- Quality checklist for content review
close_reason: Sample content and style guide written to docs/content/05-sample-content.md (1,867 lines, 16K words). Three complete learning modules (Music/Harmony, Supply & Demand, Natural Selection) with exact learner-facing text, prompts, feedback, image/audio descriptions, and novice/advanced adaptations. Content creation style guide with tone of voice, narrative voice guidelines, and vocabulary budget. Five fill-in-the-blank content templates. 40+ item quality checklist for content review.

title: Agent 2: Pedagogical Research Agent
description:
ROLE: Expert in learning science, evidence-based pedagogy, and cognitive psychology.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Research latest evidence-based learning strategies (spaced repetition, interleaving, elaborative interrogation, dual coding, concrete examples, retrieval practice)
- Map these strategies to McGilchrist's hemisphere model
- Research metacognition and self-regulated learning
- Investigate zone of proximal development and scaffolding in digital contexts
- Research motivation theory (self-determination theory, flow states)
- Analyze how existing learning apps (Duolingo, Anki, Khan Academy, Brilliant) succeed and fail
- Identify pedagogical anti-patterns (passive consumption, decontextualized drilling, premature abstraction)

OUTPUTS:
- Evidence-based learning strategies report
- Hemisphere-pedagogy mapping document
- Competitive analysis of existing learning apps
- Pedagogical principles for the app
close_reason: Comprehensive pedagogy research document written to docs/research/02-pedagogy-and-learning-science.md (1071 lines). Covers 10 evidence-based learning strategies, hemisphere-pedagogy mapping, motivation theory, competitive analysis, anti-patterns, scaffolding/ZPD, 15 actionable pedagogical principles, annotated bibliography with 60+ references.

title: Agent 7: Technical Architecture Agent
description:
ROLE: System architect responsible for technology decisions, app structure, and implementation planning.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Select and justify the tech stack (framework, database, hosting, APIs)
- Design the application architecture (frontend, backend, data layer)
- Design the content management system for learning modules
- Architect the adaptive engine and learner model storage
- Plan AI/LLM integration points (personalized feedback, content generation, Socratic dialogue)
- Design the offline-capable architecture (PWA or native)
- Plan the API structure and data models
- Design for scalability and performance
- Create the development roadmap and MVP scope
- Set up CI/CD and testing infrastructure

OUTPUTS:
- Tech stack decision document
- System architecture diagram
- Data model specification
- API design document
- MVP feature scope
- Development roadmap with milestones
close_reason: Technical architecture document written to docs/architecture/07-technical-architecture.md (2,175 lines). 12 tech stack decisions with justifications (Next.js 15, PostgreSQL/Neon, Claude API, FSRS). Full system architecture with ASCII diagrams. 20-table SQL DDL data model. OpenAPI-style endpoint specs. MVP scoping (v1.0/v1.1/v2.0). 28-week development roadmap across 5 phases. Cost analysis at ~/month for 1K users.

title: Agent 4: UI/UX Design Agent
description:
ROLE: Interface and experience design specialist who embodies hemisphere-aware design principles.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Design UI that itself reflects hemisphere balance (not just content but the interface experience)
- Right-hemisphere UI patterns: spatial navigation, visual metaphors, ambient information, gestalt layouts, organic shapes, contextual discovery
- Left-hemisphere UI patterns: structured lists, clear categorization, progress tracking, precise controls, sequential navigation
- Design the visual language and design system
- Create wireframes/mockups for core screens (home, lesson, practice, review, progress)
- Design transitions between RH and LH modes (visual cues that signal attention-mode shifts)
- Ensure accessibility (WCAG compliance)
- Design for mobile-first with responsive desktop
- Research and apply attention-aware UI patterns (reducing cognitive load, supporting flow states)

OUTPUTS:
- Design system specification
- Core screen wireframes
- Hemisphere-mode visual language guide
- Interaction pattern library
- Accessibility checklist
close_reason: Comprehensive UI/UX design document written to docs/design/04-ui-ux-design.md (2,085 lines). Covers: full design system with hex color palettes per stage, typography scales, spacing grid, shape language, motion/animation specs, sound design. Core screen designs for all 10+ screens (home, session start, encounter, transitions, analysis, return, progress, knowledge map). Hemisphere-mode visual language with 5-channel signaling. Interaction pattern library. Mobile-first responsive design (375px-1440px). WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility spec with contrast tables, screen reader support, keyboard nav, and reduced motion.

title: Agent 1: Neuroscience Research Agent

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Synthesize key concepts from 'The Master and His Emissary' and 'The Matter With Things'
- Research lateralization of brain function as it relates to learning
- Map McGilchrist's right-hemisphere-first model (whole → parts → whole) to learning stages
- Research attention modes: broad/vigilant (RH) vs narrow/focused (LH)
- Investigate how metaphor, music, narrative, and embodiment engage the right hemisphere
- Research the neuroscience of memory consolidation, emotional encoding, and contextual learning
- Identify peer-reviewed studies supporting hemisphere-informed pedagogy
- Produce a foundational research document that all other agents reference

OUTPUTS:
- Hemisphere Learning Theory document
- Key concepts glossary
- Research bibliography with annotations
- Mapping of brain functions to learning activities

title: Agent 6: Assessment & Analytics Agent
description:
ROLE: Designs measurement systems to verify learning outcomes and drive adaptive personalization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Design assessment types that measure both hemispheric learning modes:
  - RH assessments: open-ended, transfer tasks, analogy creation, contextual application, creative synthesis
  - LH assessments: recall, categorization, pattern matching, sequential problem-solving
- Design the learner model (what data to track per user)
- Design spaced repetition algorithm tuned to hemisphere-aware review
- Create analytics dashboard specifications (for learners and administrators)
- Design A/B testing framework to validate hemisphere-informed methods against controls
- Specify data collection for learning outcome research
- Design the adaptive engine that adjusts RH/LH balance based on learner performance

OUTPUTS:
- Assessment type catalog
- Learner model specification
- Spaced repetition algorithm design
- Analytics dashboard wireframes
- A/B testing plan
- Adaptive engine specification
close_reason: Assessment and analytics spec written to docs/design/06-assessment-analytics.md (1,901 lines). 16 assessment types across LH-structured, RH-open, and integrated modes. Four-layer learner model (knowledge, behavioral, cognitive, motivational). Full FSRS spaced repetition algorithm with hemisphere-aware extensions. Learner and admin analytics dashboards. Four pre-registered A/B experiments. Complete adaptive engine spec with 5 decision algorithms, 3 feedback loops, and 5 failsafes.

title: Agent 3: Instructional Designer Agent
description:
ROLE: Translates neuroscience and pedagogy research into concrete learning experience designs.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Design the core learning loop: Right→Left→Right (Whole→Parts→Whole)
  - Stage 1 (RH): Contextual introduction via narrative, metaphor, visual/spatial overview, emotional hook
  - Stage 2 (LH): Analytical breakdown, categorization, focused practice, pattern recognition
  - Stage 3 (RH): Integration, transfer, creative application, connection-making
- Design lesson structures and learning pathways
- Create scaffolding progressions for different complexity levels
- Design assessment strategies that test both hemispheric modes
- Create templates for different content types (conceptual, procedural, creative)
- Design the adaptive difficulty system
- Specify when and how to use different media (text, audio, visual, interactive)

OUTPUTS:
- Learning loop specification document
- Lesson template designs (3-5 templates)
- Assessment framework
- Adaptive difficulty algorithm spec
- Content type taxonomy
